short.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G: A simple regex checker for testing regular expressions.

long.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G:
The Regex Checker extension is a powerful and user-friendly tool designed to help developers, testers, and anyone working with regular expressions (regex). This extension allows you to easily test and debug regex patterns right from your browser. With its intuitive interface and real-time highlighting of matches, you can quickly identify how your regex pattern behaves with different test strings.

How to Use:
1. Open the extension from your browser toolbar.
2. Enter your regex pattern in the "Regex" input field.
3. Enter the test string you want to check against in the "Test String" textarea.
4. Click the "Check" button to see the matches highlighted in the test string and the match status displayed below.

Visit https://lexunit.ai/ for more resources related to text processing and artificial intelligence.
